articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli tanks advanced to the edge of the Mawasi displaced persons' camp in the northwest of the southern Gaza city of Rafah on Sunday in fierce fighting with Hamas-led fighters, residents said.
articles.title: Israeli tanks at edge of Rafah's Mawasi refuge zone, residents say

articles.author: Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Some Israeli officials have linked the military's push into Rafah in southern Gaza, where it says it is targeting the last Hamas battalions, to a potential focus on Lebanon. Gallant appeared to make the same link.
articles.title: Israel's defense chief to discuss Gaza war, Lebanon hostilities on U.S. trip

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli army forces strapped a wounded Palestinian man to the hood of the military jeep during an arrest raid in the occupied West Bank city of Jenin on Saturday.
articles.title: Israeli forces strap wounded Palestinian to jeep during raid

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Two people were injured and scores of residential and other buildings were damaged in a Russian missile attack on the Kyiv region overnight, the head of the region's state administration said on Sunday.
articles.title: Russia missile attack on Kyiv region injures two, damages houses, Ukraine says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Moscow may change the timing for use of its nuclear weapons if threats against Russia increase, the RIA state news agency cited Andrei Kartapolov, the head of the Russian lower house's defence committee, as saying on Sunday.
articles.title: Russian lawmaker warns Moscow may change timing for use of nuclear weapons

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr said on Sunday his country is not in the business of instigating wars and will always aim to settle disputes peacefully, amid escalating maritime confrontations with China.
articles.title: Philippines not in business of instigating wars, says President Marcos

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The European Union is seeking security and defence industry partnerships with Japan and South Korea aimed at joint development of military equipment, the Nikkei reported on Sunday, citing a senior EU commission official.
articles.title: EU seeks defence industry partnerships with Japan, South Korea, says Nikkei

articles.author: Ben Blanchard
articles.description: Taiwan's annual war games this year will be as close as possible to actual combat, no longer just putting on a show to score points but aiming to simulate real fighting given a rapidly rising "enemy threat" from China, a senior official said.
articles.title: Taiwan war games to mimic combat as closely as possible

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian guided bombs struck an apartment building in Ukraine's second largest city of Kharkiv, on Saturday, killing three people, injuring 29 and prompting President Volodymyr Zelenskiy to call for more help from Kyiv's allies.
articles.title: Russian bomb attack kills three, injures 29 in Ukraine's Kharkiv

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 42 people were killed in Israeli attacks on districts of Gaza City in the north of the Palestinian enclave on Saturday, the director of the Hamas-run government media office said.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill at least 42 in Gaza, enclave's government media office says
